data.text: In addition to medical and humanitarian supplies, our air cargo division @SwissWorldCargo is now operating first flights of commercial cargo in the cabin. For a detailed insight in this special operation: https://t.co/udQi1mNRxr
Happy Birthday, Switzerland! 🇨🇭 Today we’re celebrating Switzerland’s national day. 🇨🇭 https://t.co/Sh4g5PZoTk
True friends are never apart, maybe in physical distance but never in heart. ❤️ Give your friends a virtual hug today. Happy #FriendshipDay2020 https://t.co/2Df26H1Y1P
See you again in Lisbon. 🇵🇹 Our colleague Patrick tells you what to do in Lisbon right now.
✈ Besides beaches and culinary delights, Europe also impresses with its diverse architecture. 🏰 These and many more destinations are bookable now.

data.text: Hi Lauwenmark, thank you for your patience. Kindly provide us with your ticket number or booking reference so that we may clarify further and advise you accordingly. Kind regards, Bernadette

We are happy to welcome back our guests to the SWISS Senator Lounge A @zrh_airport as of today. The one-class lounge includes a dedicated area for Lufthansa Group First Class passengers and HON Circle Members. https://t.co/efM1En5lMW

data.text: Hi Jackie, please note that you can get the flight schedule for SWISS on the following link : https://t.co/BeVvIeXMPl . Kind regards, Sione.
ℹ Uncertain times raise a lot of questions: We have therefore compiled the most important information about refunds. https://t.co/pKu1jFswbX
How does a flight without passengers but with cargo in the cabin look like? First Officer Sascha takes you on his cargo-only flight to Shanghai: https://t.co/SOTnxI6Ge5 https://t.co/nHSNUrnD0z

"Welcome on board" ✈
On yesterday's flight LX189 from Shanghai to Zurich we were pleased to welcome guests on board again. https://t.co/kAfJJb8bJk

We are introducing fully wrapped meals free of charge on intercontinental flights from Zurich on trial. Would you consider this option on your next flight? For more information: https://t.co/GNq2WqnDeA https://t.co/gEX1UqCfp1

data.text: SWISS has embarked on a collaboration with the "Berufsschule Bülach" for the training of its aircraft engineers. The team-up offers sizeable synergic benefits, particularly for the SWISS trainees, including shorter and more efficient theoretical training: https://t.co/htEVHvQzls https://t.co/zA3X0vMgqH

SWISS makes face masks compulsory on board with immediate effect. Passengers are required to wear a face mask during boarding, while in the air and until fully disembarked. SWISS recommends the use of general fabric masks or medical-grade protective masks: https://t.co/cg92b58VBr https://t.co/04SWI3dEk2

data.text: Uncertain times raise a lot questions: We have therefore compiled the most important information about flight booking, rebooking and refund options. https://t.co/uEqf8SjKgB
🌍 Hello, world. Great to see you again. ✈ We will gradually expand our route network over the coming weeks and months. More Information: https://t.co/LOM6BLI1oF https://t.co/HStZWcV6Da

(2/2) In order to reduce your waiting time, please only contact us if your flight was originally scheduled to take place within the next 72 hours. Should your flight have been scheduled for a later date, please get in touch with us at a later time.

(1/2) Due to flight schedule changes, you may experience longer waiting times in our service centers. We have increased our capacities to a maximum and are doing everything we can to handle your rebooking and refund requests as quickly as possible. https://t.co/7ij5m7I50c

Traveling in times of Corona can be associated with many uncertainties like increasing number of infections or new travel warnings. In order for you to plan your trip worry-free despite uncertainties, SWISS promises a return flight on all European routes. https://t.co/SjK6o3GzNV https://t.co/WeZ9ybTmsh

data.text: SWISS and Edelweiss welcome the decision by Lufthansa’s shareholders at today’s Extraordinary General Meeting to approve the corporate actions proposed and required. The company’s liquidity has thereby been secured.

data.text: We are aware that you have many questions about your next journey. The SWISS Travel Briefing gives you an overview of the most important things you should take note of on your next flight: https://t.co/9aOWcfzM2q https://t.co/QHUmywIeVx
"Planes are there for flying." ✈️ Our colleagues explain, what preparations have to be made for an orderly return flight from the airfield Dübendorf to Zurich-Kloten. https://t.co/wjolER0qBe
🌈 We are “Proud above the Clouds”. Happy #PrideMonth2020. https://t.co/nyEaTGKWLw
After more than three months, we are bringing back our parked aircraft from the airfield Dübendorf to Zurich-Kloten. Grüezi @zrh_airport! 👋❤️ https://t.co/w1M4RUV9Jw

Roland and his team are responsible for ensuring that all maintenance work on the SWISS fleet is properly planned and performed. In our new issue of #AskTheExpert you will learn what makes this job so special in times of Corona.

data.text: Over the next three days, SWISS and Edelweiss are expected to fly 17 aircraft from their temporary home in Dübendorf airfield back to @zrh_airport . Our Airbus A320 HB-IJD has already returned successfully. ✈️ https://t.co/9HRGWk9NPf

We have handed over 11'000 SWISS Overnight Kits to "GAiN Switzerland". The organisation has helped to set up an isolation station at Moria refugee camp on the island of Lesbos, Greece. Our overnight kits are the basis for hygiene articles which are provided to the people on site. https://t.co/BzQIpqtfae

How has the onboard experience changed on long-haul flights due to the current Corona situation? When will SWISS reopen the lounges in Zurich and Geneva? Annette Mann, Head of Onboard & Passenger Services, answers these and other questions in our second issue of #AskTheExpert.

data.text: "In network planning the highest flexibility is currently required"- Learn more about the challenges in times of Corona in the new blog series #AskTheExpert. data.text: Modification of a Boeing 777-300ER: In order to be able to transport additional cargo, the SWISS Economy seats were removed and the aircraft is converted into a so-called "CARRY-freighter" (Cargo with removed seats in Y-class). https://t.co/FqGrcLAU9H

data.text: Today, SWISS operated its first flight from Hong Kong to Zurich since the end of March. Thank you for the warm welcome. 🎉 As of June, we will be operating twice-weekly flights between Zurich and Hong Kong. https://t.co/VcSXJk261F

We will gradually expanding our route network over the coming weeks and months. Along with many intercontinental routes, we are happy that major European cities and attractive tourist destinations will be serviced again by SWISS. All flights listed here: https://t.co/JC9loHwRww
👨‍🔧 ✈️ The sophisticated air circulation system in our aircraft enables a complete exchange of air in about 3 minutes. Our aircraft engineer Tim explains how it works. https://t.co/Fp96lt6xsk

As a result of the coronavirus pandemic and its unprecedented impact on the air transport sector, SWISS incurred an operating loss of CHF 84.1 million for the first quarter of 2020. Full financial report: https://t.co/HHuBC0m5x6 https://t.co/0viPNAFW8k

data.text: By including further intercontinental destinations to the SWISS route network, @SwissWorldCargo can expand its services as of 15 May. Another 160 cargo flights are planned by the end of June, also to first-ever destinations such as Toronto or Shenzhen. https://t.co/S2GI36ALcj

data.text: We are happy to announce that we will partially resume our flight operations as of June. Up to 190 flights will be operated from Zurich and Geneva and will be gradually increased over the weeks ahead. ✈🌍

A repatriation flight from New Zealand to Switzerland and cargo in the passenger cabin: new territory for SWISS. What does it mean to organize these special flights? Read all about it on our blog: https://t.co/fEsem23rIY
Hi, many thanks for the input. We are happy to take note of this and will forward the idea to the appropriate department. Kind regards, Petra
📦✈ Find out more about the first flight in SWISS's history on which cargo was transported not only in the cargo hold but also in the passenger cabin: https://t.co/rUAfWgCk75

In line with the upcoming easing of entry restrictions of various European countries, SWISS plans to increase its flight capacity as of June with up to 170 weekly flights from Zurich and Geneva to numerous destinations in Europe. More information here: https://t.co/yuZCd0f06b https://t.co/x1e5EDcUfv

data.text: Repatriation and cargo flights are always carefully planned. But above all, flexible solutions are required for those journeys. In order to guarantee technical support at any time, our «Flying Station Engineers» fly along.

@golecmonika, please be advised that your refund will be processed, however, currently the process is on hold and we will not be able to confirm the time frame in which the process will be completed. Kind Regards, Florence.

SWISS and Edelweiss Air are grateful for the Federal Council's decision to provide Swiss aviation with the necessary liquidity to survive the impact of the corona crisis. Please find the Federal Council's decision here: https://t.co/H4uzwKoLZT https://t.co/3ZHLSTIM4A

data.text: As of 4 May, SWISS recommends that all passengers carry their own mouth-nose covering on board all flights. This measure provides additional protection against the transmission of SARS CoV2 for everyone. https://t.co/CNBlhfjZiq

Passengers whose flight has been cancelled, or who were unable to travel, may keep their ticket and rebook before 31 August 2020 to a new departure date – latest 30 April 2021. Travels before 31 December 2020 will be granted a discount of CHF 50 in the form of a flight voucher. https://t.co/ugKsKdNZ5E

data.text:
SWISS' minimum timetable remains in force until 31 May 2020. 
SWISS will continue to serve 7 European cities from Zurich and 4 from Geneva. Furthermore, SWISS will continue to operate three weekly long-haul flights to Newark (USA). More information: https://t.co/yuZCd0f06b https://t.co/7vhTyYipgz

"Once again, I learned that teamwork is everything." 
What already started as a special duty ended up being a week-long repatriation flight to Bangkok and Laos. SWISS Flight Attendant Eliane Huonder shares her diary with us: https://t.co/rs1T0Hc5Fn
#swissatheart https://t.co/7ddfwyaP0G
RT @SwissWorldCargo: Looking forward to the new cargo only flights network. We operated over 80 flights transporting over 1,300 tons of car…

Yesterday, our last repatriation flight on behalf of @EDA_DFAE returned safely from Cochin and Kolkata, India. We are proud to have been part of this great endeavour. Thank you to our colleagues for their great work and for flying more than 2000 travellers back to Switzerland. ❤ https://t.co/tlQjdftfqv

data.text: Yesterday evening, two machines for the production of FFP2 protective masks arrived in Switzerland. We are proud that we were able to transport the machines from Shanghai to Zurich on behalf of @vbs_ddps and @gd_zuerich. https://t.co/435P7xUngL

The first cargo-only flight landed in Geneva. On behalf of Geneva University Hospital and the Canton of Geneva, the SWISS Boeing 777 carried syringes and several million surgical masks from Shanghai to Switzerland. https://t.co/wi6boeNavd

data.text: Your flight got cancelled? Utilize your full and unused ticket value and collect your personal CHF 50 flight voucher on top now. 🎁 More information: https://t.co/G7W1PRRund https://t.co/aRy7WWBD28

urls.title: Flight Value Voucher
urls.description: Did you book your flight after 15 May 2020 or was your place of departure in Greece, Bulgaria, Slovakia or outside the EU, Switzerland, the United Kingdom or the USA? Use our flexible rebooking options. Open the confirmation link that you have received by email and log onto the Flight Value Voucher portal with your swiss.com or Miles & More profile. Download your Flight Value Voucher as a PDF file. You can also view the voucher again at any time via the portal. Book your new trip online using your

They just can't wait to wear their uniform and take you to the sky again✈️ - our dear colleagues' version of the #DontRushChallenge 

Thank you for being awesome❤️ #swissatheart https://t.co/ub3erzjsrJ

Thank you @SAS for the nomination - dream now, compete later seems like a great idea 💓This is our HB-JMC above a  blooming rapeseed field. Now show your beautiful planes @eurowings @helvetic_en @flyedelweiss #swissatheart https://t.co/4UWDcuPu2r https://t.co/pxpwRkoBFc

data.text: Due to continuing travel restrictions, SWISS has decided to extend its minimum timetable to 17 May. SWISS will continue to serve a selected number of European routes from Zurich and Geneva and operate three weekly flights from Zurich to New York (EWR): https://t.co/yuZCd0f06b https://t.co/YRA6VV1P7G

SWISS has announced that long-serving SWISS Board of Directors members Harry Hohmeister and Ulrik Svensson stepped down from their positions. Their successors are Christina Foerster and Dr. Detlef Kayser of the LHG Executive Board. For more info: https://t.co/1Pq35m5SWP https://t.co/MNh82khbWb
Zurich🛫Mumbai🛬Delhi🛫Zurich. Another rather unusual SWISS rotation on behalf of @EDA_DFAE took place last week, bringing home stranded passengers from India. https://t.co/oqq7XwPPE0

Time passes and we may be apart, but we are always #swissatheart. 
📷 Copyright: VBS https://t.co/XxB8iMD4gv

This SWISS rotation was one for the books: The first time ever, a SWISS aircraft landed in Auckland and the last time, our Captain Jürg Hasler operated a commercial flight. We thank Jürg for all his work and wish him a happy retirement. 👨🏼‍✈️#swissatheart https://t.co/dnO4B7ytQv

🍫 We donate more than a tonne of Easter chocolates to healthcare providers which would normally have been given to our guests on board our aircraft: We would like to take this opportunity to thank all healthcare staff for their efforts during the current situation. #swissatheart https://t.co/r3W7wYNfcn
RT @AKL_Airport: Long-haul departures are always emotional, but today’s flights for @lufthansa and @FlySWISS were really special. The team…

data.text:
🇳🇿 Another repatriation flight on behalf of @EDA_DFAE has commenced its journey home.🇨🇭This morning at 9.47h (LT.) the first SWISS aircraft ever left Auckland towards Zurich via Bangkok to bring back home stranded passengers. Have a safe flight LX8909. 
🎥:https://t.co/739qCOLYMF https://t.co/HyVAWwpioV

Last night, a SWISS Airbus A340 loaded with medical supplies landed in @zrh_airport. For the first time ever, freight was transported in the belly as well as in the passenger cabin. https://t.co/9f5m3kf1ux

SWISS is to perform more than ten cargo flights from China to Switzerland on behalf of the Zurich Cantonal Pharmacy. Over 35 million personal protection items for the use of healthcare personnel will be transported both in the hold and the passenger cabin. https://t.co/fp5DSJdKXF

From Bangkok with Love. ❤️After a short stop in Laos, where stranded tourists were picked up, LX181 on behalf of @EDA_DFAE landed back in Zurich yesterday. The detour to Vientiane entailed a large amount of planning work, as no SWISS aircraft has ever landed in Laos before. https://t.co/N8KAhw65gc
RT @gd_zuerich: Der Flieger von @FlySWISS aus Shanghai ist heute, 17.54 Uhr, in Zürich gelandet. An Bord: Schutzmaterial für die Zürcher Sp…

Tarik works as an M/C in Geneva and lives in France. In response to the increased border controls, he has taken measures to ensure he wouldn't be late for work: bike instead of car, fresh air instead of traffic jams. This is what we call dedication! 🚴‍♂️✈️❤️ #swissatheart https://t.co/K4tmX4blcw

Second return flight within Europe: ✈️ from Belgrade lands in Zurich.
 
👉https://t.co/sxeJXi1DWJ
 
#CoronaIn…
Here's a little message from our crew! 😘 Happy weekend and take care! #swissatheart https://t.co/JjLOzEpGoX
Your health is our priority. Due to the current situation we have implemented additional measures to ensure your safety on board and on ground. #PhysicalDistancing https://t.co/vYULiHNh4B

More flexibility for future bookings worldwide 🌍: With immediate effect, SWISS tickets are rebookable in all fare classes, including Light fares with only carry-on baggage: https://t.co/yuZCd0f06b https://t.co/ZZLeLML2ei
HB-IJL has brought home stranded passengers from Tunis to @GeneveAeroport and @zrh_airport. Big thanks to our crew on this @EDA_DFAE repatriation flight. ❤️#swissatheart https://t.co/XMnEXa49ow

RT @SwissMFA: #FlyingHome 🇨🇭

 Second landing today of a #FlyingHome flight ✈️  from Tunis with 91 Swiss travellers. Welcome back! 😉

👉 htt…

Yesterday, our Airbus A340 arrived back from Beijing, bringing home much needed medical supplies. Thank you @SwissWorldCargo for your engagement in securing the supply chain and connecting Switzerland to the world. https://t.co/lRGBQTwAnq

data.text: We are proud to be supporting the largest repatriation operation in the history of Switzerland. Check out this video by the @EDA_DFAE to get an impression about the organization: https://t.co/Z7OuqbJdNx https://t.co/ZTtVasQNxG
LX181 has landed safely @zrh_airport yesterday. Welcome home! 🇨🇭 More repatriation flights on behalf of the @EDA_DFAE are being planned. https://t.co/1eEZFOJ5jH
Update from the flight deck on LX181: the atmosphere on board is good and our guests are looking forward to coming home. 🇨🇭 #swissatheart https://t.co/5a1qh5NwJ6

Repatriation flight LX181 on behalf of @EDA_DFAE is on its way from Bangkok to @zrh_airport with 216 Swiss travelers on board. Many thanks to our lovely crew! ❤️
@flightradar24: https://t.co/CAUxJCW4YY https://t.co/DZFyi9rTdp
The landing of the repatriation flight LX8901 on behalf of @EDA_DFAE from Chile.🇨🇭 Fun fact: the last SWISS flight to Santiago took off almost 11 years ago to the day. https://t.co/w0bcqylqOr

data.text: Welcome home LX8901 passengers and crew.❤️ The special repatriation flight landed safely @zurichairport, bringing home 254 passengers stuck in Chile due to #covid_19. Special thanks to our crew for their extraordinary work & commitment. #swissatheart https://t.co/vYhl4GKkI3
